intro: Mentzelia rhombifolia, commonly known as the diamondleaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its narrow, rhomboid-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is part of the Loasaceae family and is often found in desert habitats. Mentzelia rhombifolia is a perennial herb that blooms in late spring and early summer.
